name: Ponsona
description:
A blend of JRPG and Match-3 elements, Ponsona was inspired by Panel de Pon / Tetris Attack / Pokemon Puzzle League and the Shin Megami Tensei series. Navigate the halls of your school in 1st person as you foil a sinister plot.

Created as a submission for Inspire Jam 2022 by Dallas Society of Play.

Controls

WASD / Arrow Keys

  • Navigate 1st person dungeon crawling view
  • Choose battle commands
  • Move block swap cursor during battle

Enter/ Spacebar

  • Progress through dialogue boxes
  • Open doors
  • Confirm battle commands
  • Swap blocks horizontally

Escape

  • Open main menu (unavailable during combat)

Use the "Swap" battle command to form combos and chains by moving the cursor and horizontally swapping adjacent pairs of blocks. Match three or more blocks of the same color horizontally and/or vertically to score a combo. Score large combos to attack enemies with elemental damage based on the color of the first combo scored that turn. You have a limited amount of time to make as many swaps as wanted.

The "Push" command will push up new blocks onto the playing field from the bottom of the screen. Blocks can be pushed safely outside of the playing field without risking defeat. More blocks mean more chances for bigger combos and longer chains.

The player will be defeated if blocks are stacked outside of the playing field at the end of a turn when using the "Swap" battle command. Metal junk blocks cannot be matched but will automatically disappear if adjacent to a color combo when scored.
